sndlib.core.network
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.network.Node

public final class Node
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a single node in a Network.

Besides its ID a node can possesses coordinates, which can be either simple pixel coordinates or geographical, with the x-coordinate to be the longitude and the y-coordinate the latitude.

For constructing a new Node a parent Network is needed.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Network, Network.newNode(String), Network.newNode(String, double, double)

setCoordinates

public void setCoordinates(double xCoord,
                           double yCoord)
Sets the coordinates of this node.

Parameters:
xCoord - the x-coordinate (longitude)
yCoord - the y-coordinate (latitude)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this node's coordinates type is NodeCoordinatesType.GEOGRAPHICAL and the given x-coordinate (resp. y-coordinate) is not in the range (-180, 180] (resp. [-90, 90])
